Description: Head of female terracotta figure wearing her hair back, following Tanagra types. Solid and mould-made. Orange-reddish Nile silt clay with grey core.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University of Pennsylvania Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology, Philadelphia. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Egyptian parallels in Dresden have been dated to the late 3rd and 2nd centuries BC (Fischer 1994, 179-181). Marked '6' in ink on back. Findspot noted on Philadelphia register card and in Egypt Exploration Fund distribution list. = Egypt Exploration Fund distribution list Philadelphia no. 30. Fischer, J. 1994, Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber, Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen, Tübinger Studien zur Archäologie und Kunstgeschichte 14, Tübingen.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.406) (Phase 1)
